treatment.reference: A ubiquitous thermoacidophilic archaeon from deep-sea hydrothermal vents Nature 442:444-447
treatment.description: Anaerobic heterotrophic sulphur- and iron-reducing thermoacidophile belonging to the kingdom Euryarchaeota. Cells are pleiomorphic to spherical, about 0.6–1 µm in diameter, with a single flagellum and an S-layer. Grows best at 70˚C and pH 4.2–4.8. From actively venting deep-sea vent deposits, first isolated from deep-sea vents at 22˚ 10.8’ S, 176˚ 36.1’ W (Mariner vent field). Used yeast extract, casein, trypticase, and peptone as an electron donor. Used ferric iron or S˚ as an electron acceptor. Requires NaCl (optimum 2.5-3.5%) for growth. Membrane lipids are predominantly composed of glycerol dibiphytanyl glycerol tetraethers containing 0–4 cyclopentane rings.
